message.content: Now let me fix the CORS configuration to be more secure:

function.arguments: {"command": "str_replace", "path": "/workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py", "old_str": "CORS(app)  # Enable CORS for all routes", "new_str": "# Configure CORS with specific allowed origins\nallowed_origins = [\"http://localhost:8080\", \"http://127.0.0.1:8080\"]\nCORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r\"/api/*\": {}})", "security_risk": "LOW"}
function.name: str_replace_editor

content:
The file /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py has been edited. Here's the result of running `cat -n` on a snippet of /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py:
    75	
    76	# Initialize Flask application
    77	app = Flask(__name__)
    78	# Configure CORS with specific allowed origins
    79	allowed_origins = ["http://localhost:8080", "http://127.0.0.1:8080"]
    80	CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})
    81	
    82	# Test specific configuration
    83	# Check app.config first in case it's set by test runner, then env var
    84	if app.config.get('TESTING') or os.environ.get('TESTING') == 'true':
    85	
Review the changes and make sure they are as expected. Edit the file again if necessary.

extras.old_content: CORS(app)  # Enable CORS for all routes
extras.new_content:
# Configure CORS with specific allowed origins
allowed_origins = ["http://localhost:8080", "http://127.0.0.1:8080"]
CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})
extras.diff:
--- /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py
+++ /workspace/SheepVibes/backend/app.py
@@ -78 +78,3 @@
-CORS(app)  # Enable CORS for all routes
+# Configure CORS with specific allowed origins
+allowed_origins = ["http://localhost:8080", "http://127.0.0.1:8080"]
+CORS(app, origins=allowed_origins, resources={r"/api/*": {}})
